title: Prevailing showery conditions to reduce from tomorrow
byline: The prevailing showery condition over the island is expected to reduce from tomorrow (15), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Uganda shuts down internet ahead of election, orders rights groups to halt work
byline: Ugandan authorities cut internet access and limited mobile services across the country on Tuesday, two days before an election in which President Yoweri Museveni will stand for a contentious seventh term after four decades in power.

title: Two killed in head-on motorcycle collision in Puttalam
byline: Two individuals have died in a head-on motorcycle collision that occurred in the Attawilluwa area of Puttalam last night (13), police said.

title: Controversial Dilbert cartoonist Scott Adams dies aged 68
byline: Scott Adams, the US cartoonist who wrote and illustrated the comic strip Dilbert, has died of cancer at the age of 68.

title: We choose Denmark over US, Greenland’s PM says
byline: Greenland’s prime minister has said his people would choose Denmark over the US if they were asked to make such a choice “here and now”.

title: Unidentified individuals torch Sarvajana Balaya party office in Jaffna
byline: An unidentified group set fire to the Sarvajana Balaya Party office located in the Thavady area of Jaffna around midnight yesterday (13).

title: US approves sale of Nvidia’s advanced H200 chips to China
byline: The US government has given chip giant Nvidia the green light to sell its advanced artificial intelligence (AI) processors in China, the Department of Commerce said on Tuesday.

title: TV Derana awarded as Sri Lanka’s leading media brand at Superbrands 2025
byline: TV Derana has been awarded as a premier national brand at the Superbrands 2025 Awards Ceremony held in Colombo.

title: State Department urges US citizens to leave Iran immediately
byline: The U.S. government has issued an urgent advisory for American citizens to leave Iran immediately, according to a notice published Tuesday by the U.S. virtual embassy in Tehran.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western Province.

title: Denmark and Greenland to face Vance in high-stakes White House meeting
byline: The Danish and Greenlandic foreign ministers will meet U.S. Vice President JD Vance at the White House on Wednesday, as President Donald Trump reiterated his demand that Washington must take control of Greenland, an autonomous territory of Denmark.

title: 22 killed, over 30 injured as crane collapse derails train in Thailand
byline: A train travelling from Bangkok to Thailand’s northeast province was derailed after a construction crane fell on top of one of its carriages, killing at least 22 people and injuring at least 30, police said.

title: Trinco Buddha statue incident: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others remanded
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and five other individuals have been remanded until January 19 by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court for allegedly violating coastal conservation laws by placing a Buddha statue at the Trincomalee Bodhiraja Vihara on November 16, 2025.

title: Badulla District Labour Office receives bomb threat email
byline: A bomb scare was reported at the Badulla District Labour Office this morning (14) following the receipt of an anonymous email warning of an explosive device within the office premises.

title: Imported milk powder prices to be reduced
byline: Powdered milk importers have agreed to reduce the price of milk powder packets with effect from January 16, the Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe said.

title: US Ambassador Julie Chung pays farewell call on PM Harini
byline: Outgoing US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, has paid a farewell call on Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees today (14), marking the conclusion of her tenure in Sri Lanka.

title: Opposition Leader criticizes proposed electricity policy, calls for public consultation
byline: Leader of the Opposition, Sajith Premadasa, has criticized the newly proposed electricity policy of the National People’s Power (NPP) government, stating that it unfairly impacts both consumers and the renewable energy sector, while disproportionately affecting low-income earners.

title: Education Ministry issues special announcement on 2026 school academic activities
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued a statement regarding the conduct of school academic activities beginning from January 21, 2026.

title: Retired Navy Medical Assistant arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A retired Navy Medical Assistant has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with accepting a bribe of Rs. 200,000.

title: Pakistan, Sri Lanka agree to promote religious tourism, boost cultural cooperation
byline: Pakistan and Sri Lanka have agreed to expand cultural cooperation by promoting religious tourism, aiming to hold joint cultural exhibitions and heritage programs, according to an official statement on Tuesday.

title: Wimal Weerawansa appears before court after arrest warrant issued
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, against whom an arrest warrant was issued today by the Colombo High Court, appeared before the court a short while ago.

title: US to suspend visa processing for 75 nations next week, Fox News reports
byline: The Trump administration is suspending all visa processing for visitors from 75 countries starting January 21, Fox News reported on Wednesday, citing a memo from the US State Department.

title: K-Pop sensation BTS announces return with new world tour
byline: Chart-topping K-pop boy band BTS announced on Tuesday it will embark on a concert tour starting in April after the release of its first new album in more than three years.

title: Parliament to convene from January 20 to 23
byline: Parliamentary business relevant to the second parliamentary week of January 2026 was decided at the meeting of the Committee on Parliamentary Business held today (14) under the Chairmanship of the Deputy Speaker, Dr. Rizvie Salih.

title: Motorists urged to exercise caution on expressways due to heavy fog
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has issued a warning to motorists, urging them to exercise heightened caution while driving on expressways due to the dense fog currently affecting several regions.

title: Police intensify crack down on drunk, drug-impaired driving
byline: Police have intensified measures against drivers operating vehicles under the influence of drugs, with a mobile laboratory now in operation to detect drug-impaired driving, according to Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police in charge of the Traffic and Road Safety Range, W. P. J. Senadeera.

title: Stock market’s ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange’s benchmark All Share Price Index (ASPI) hit a new all-time high of 23,708.70 points today (14), surpassing the previous record of 23,659.70 points set on 12 November 2025.

title: UK expected to approve ‘mega’ Chinese embassy in London despite objections
byline: Britain’s government is expected to approve a “mega” Chinese embassy close to London’s financial district after years of controversy and political wrangling over the potential security risks it poses to the U.K.

title: SOC reviews amendment bills seeking to curb drug trafficking in high seas
byline: The attention of the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Governance, Justice and Civil Protection has been drawn to the Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) Bill and the Judicature (Amendment) Bill.

title: Court postpones verdict in ex-MP Amarakeerthi Athukorala’s murder
byline: The Gampaha High Court Trial-at-Bar has announced today (14) that the delivery of the verdict in the case pertaining to the murder of former Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala has been postponed until 11 February.

title: No electricity tariff revision for first quarter of 2026 - PUCSL
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has decided not to implement an electricity tariff revision for the first quarter of 2026 due to the failure of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to submit a formal tariff revision proposal within the due time.

title: Arrest warrant issued for Wimal Weerawansa
byline: The Colombo High Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of former Minister Wimal Weerawansa for failing to appear before the court in connection with a case filed by the Bribery Commission.

title: Arrest warrant against Wimal Weerawansa recalled
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the recall of the arrest warrant issued against former Minister Wimal Weerawansa after he appeared before the court through his legal counsel.

title: Police recover 11kg of ‘Ice’ and heroin from vehicle on Expressway; 2 arrested
byline: Around 6 kg of Crystal Methamphetamine (“Ice”) and 5 kg of heroin were recovered, and two suspects along with their vehicle were taken into custody by the Expressway Highway Police at the Godagama–Palatuwa interchange on the Southern Expressway, police said.

title: Sri Lankan husband admits murdering ex-wife in UK
byline: A Sri Lankan-born husband has admitted stabbing his ex-wife to death on a quiet suburban street in Cardiff, Wales.
